alert.note: Alert for Bear River Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Teton Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 03 at 2:55AM MST until March 03 at 9:00PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, except higher totals east of Ashton and Island Park in Fremont County and above pass level in the Bear River Range, and lower totals of 1 to 3 inches in Driggs. Winds gusting 20 to 30 MPH. * WHERE...The Bear River Range, Teton Valley, and Island Park region, including but not limited to Emigration Summit, Driggs, Tetonia, Ashton, Ashton Hill, and Island Park. * WHEN...Until 9 PM MST this evening. The majority of the snow will fall this morning, while winds will remain breezy throughout the day. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, reduced visibility, and pockets of blowing and drifting snow.
info.instruction: If you will be commuting or traveling across the advisory area, slow down, use extra caution, and plan extra time to reach your destination. The latest highway conditions are available at 511.idaho.gov, the Idaho 511 App, or by calling 511.

area.areaDesc: Bear River Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Teton Valley
